articles.headline: Peacock, NBC’s Streaming Service, Will Have a Free Option and ‘The Office’
articles.snippet: Comcast, a late convert to streaming, is distinguishing itself from Netflix and other competitors by embracing ads.
articles.abstract: Comcast, a late convert to streaming, is distinguishing itself from Netflix and other competitors by embracing ads.
articles.lead_paragraph: Despite taking its name from one of the flashiest animals on the planet, NBCUniversal’s Peacock streaming service is at risk of blending in with the flock.
articles.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Edmund Lee

articles.headline: Senate Opens Trump Impeachment Trial as New Ukraine Revelations Emerge
articles.snippet: The chief justice was sworn in as the presiding officer and senators swore to do “impartial justice,” as the Senate opened only the third presidential impeachment trial in U.S. history.
articles.abstract: The chief justice was sworn in as the presiding officer and senators swore to do “impartial justice,” as the Senate opened only the third presidential impeachment trial in U.S. history.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate formally opened the impeachment trial of President Trump on Thursday, bracing for a deeply divisive debate over his fate as senators swore to deliver “impartial justice” and installed Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. to preside over the proceeding.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Google Reaches $1 Trillion in Value, Even as It Faces New Tests
articles.snippet: The internet search giant became the fourth tech company — after Apple, Amazon and Microsoft — to reach the market milestone.
articles.abstract: The internet search giant became the fourth tech company — after Apple, Amazon and Microsoft — to reach the market milestone.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Numbers have long held a special significance at Google.

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Investigating Years-Old Leaks and Appears Focused on Comey
articles.snippet: An inquiry into years-old disclosures of classified information is highly unusual and leaves law enforcement officials open to accusations of politicizing their work.
articles.abstract: An inquiry into years-old disclosures of classified information is highly unusual and leaves law enforcement officials open to accusations of politicizing their work.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal prosecutors in Washington are investigating a years-old leak of classified information about a Russian intelligence document, and they appear to be focusing on whether the former F.B.I. director James B. Comey illegally provided details to reporters, according to people familiar with the inquiry.

articles.headline: Barneys Workers Feel Used as They March Store Toward Death
articles.snippet: As the retailer goes through liquidation, employees at its flagship store say they haven’t received information about a closing date, severance pay or benefits.
articles.abstract: As the retailer goes through liquidation, employees at its flagship store say they haven’t received information about a closing date, severance pay or benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: A job at Barneys New York once represented a glimmering opportunity in a challenging retail landscape — the kind of chain where sales associates might work for decades, earning competitive salaries as well as commissions, while honing expertise in fine jewelry and designer apparel.

articles.headline: For the Senators Who Will Judge Trump, an Incomplete Story to Consider
articles.snippet: Recent interviews by Lev Parnas, an associate of the president’s personal lawyer, as well as documents released by House investigators, reinforced that there is more still to be learned.
articles.abstract: Recent interviews by Lev Parnas, an associate of the president’s personal lawyer, as well as documents released by House investigators, reinforced that there is more still to be learned.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — By the time the Senate opened impeachment trials for Andrew Johnson and Bill Clinton, its members pretty well knew the facts of the accusations against the presidents. None of them needed to turn on “The Rachel Maddow Show” to learn things they did not already know.

articles.headline: Why Mothers’ Choices About Work and Family Often Feel Like No Choice at All
articles.snippet: When policymakers frame “choices” as personal preferences, it distracts from major structural constraints.
articles.abstract: When policymakers frame “choices” as personal preferences, it distracts from major structural constraints.
articles.lead_paragraph: If liberals and conservatives can agree on anything about family policies, it’s this: Parents should have choices.

articles.headline: Trump Fans or Not, Business Owners Are Wary of Warren and Sanders
articles.snippet: Some executives at small companies have reservations about President Trump, but also concerns about Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren.
articles.abstract: Some executives at small companies have reservations about President Trump, but also concerns about Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren.
articles.lead_paragraph: When it comes to President Trump’s economic policies, there is not much that appeals to Grady Cope, the founder of a machining and assembly company in Englewood, Colo.

articles.headline: Trump Legal Team Adds Starr and Dershowitz for Senate Trial
articles.snippet: Ken Starr and a third lawyer named to the team, Robert Ray, were independent counsels who investigated President Bill Clinton.
articles.abstract: Ken Starr and a third lawyer named to the team, Robert Ray, were independent counsels who investigated President Bill Clinton.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump enlisted the former independent counsel Ken Starr and the celebrity lawyer Alan Dershowitz to join his defense team on Friday, turning to two veterans of politically charged legal cases to secure his acquittal in the Senate impeachment trial that gets underway in earnest next week.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Peter Baker
